page.title: 04IMPERIAL CHEMICAL INDUSTRY
page.content: The I.C.I.is a large company manufacturing paints,chemicals, plastics and fibres. I.C.I.Fibres at Brockworth was formed in 1965.This division is one of the largest single companies producing synthetic fibres in Europe, and employs about 1400 people. The raw material is nylon polymer which is produced as a by-product of the cracking and processing of crude oil.The polymer is produced at another plant in Teeside,and is transported to Gloucester by road at the rate of 100 tonnes per day. The nylon manufactured is sold mainly to the clothing industry for such end uses as hosiery, lingerie,shirting,dresswear,foundation garments,protective clothing and upholstery. Production is continuous throughout the year:650 tonnes per week,more than 50% export.
